titleproper.value: Guide to the John Lovari Collection of the Staff of the New-York Historical Society Organizing Records <num>WAG.169</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: John Lovari Collection of the Staff of the New-York Historical Society Organizing Records

abstract.value: In 1979 the staff of the New-York Historical Society began an organizing drive with District 65, United Automobile Workers of America. Victory in the union elections led to contract negotiations, and the staff conducted a six month strike before signing a collective bargaining agreement in 1980. This collection contains newspaper clippings, photographs, minutes from the negotiating committee, copies of contracts, and leaflets.

p.value: Identification of item, date; John Lovari Collection of the Staff of the New-York Historical Society Organizing Records; WAG 169; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by John A. Lovari in 2000. The accession number 2000.029 is associated with this gift.
John Lovari was a reference librarian at the New-York Historical Society, head of the negotiating committee, and after an agreement was reached, a shop steward.
This collection contains newspaper clippings, photographs, minutes from the negotiating committee, copies of contracts, and leaflets.

subject.value: Library employees |x Labor unions |z New York (State) |z New York.
